What does this data set describe?

Title: VectorGIS_prd.DBO.DemolishedBuilding
Abstract: Outline and location of demolished buildings.
  1. How should this data set be cited?

    of Lynchburg, Virginia, VectorGIS_prd.DBO.DemolishedBuilding.

    Online Links:

    • Server=murloc; Service=sde:sqlserver:murloc; Database=vectorgis_prd; Version=DBO.GIS

  2. What geographic area does the data set cover?

    West_Bounding_Coordinate: -79.268155
    East_Bounding_Coordinate: -79.089160
    North_Bounding_Coordinate: 37.466914
    South_Bounding_Coordinate: 37.328225

  3. What does it look like?

  4. Does the data set describe conditions during a particular time period?

  5. What is the general form of this data set?

    Geospatial_Data_Presentation_Form: vector digital data

  6. How does the data set represent geographic features?

    1. How are geographic features stored in the data set?

      This is a Vector data set. It contains the following vector data types (SDTS terminology):

      • G-polygon (1197)

    2. What coordinate system is used to represent geographic features?

      The map projection used is Lambert Conformal Conic.

      Projection parameters:
      Standard_Parallel: 36.766667
      Standard_Parallel: 37.966667
      Longitude_of_Central_Meridian: -78.500000
      Latitude_of_Projection_Origin: 36.333333
      False_Easting: 11482916.666667
      False_Northing: 3280833.333333

      coordinates are encoded using coordinate pair
      Abscissae (x-coordinates) are specified to the nearest 0.000500
      Ordinates (y-coordinates) are specified to the nearest 0.000500
      coordinates are specified in survey feet

      The horizontal datum used is North American Datum of 1983.
      The ellipsoid used is Geodetic Reference System 80.
      The semi-major axis of the ellipsoid used is 6378137.000000.
      The flattening of the ellipsoid used is 1/298.257222.

      Vertical_Coordinate_System_Definition:
      Altitude_System_Definition:
      Altitude_Resolution: 0.000100
      Altitude_Encoding_Method:
      Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

  7. How does the data set describe geographic features?

    VectorGIS_prd.DBO.DemolishedBuilding

    OBJECTID
    Internal feature number. (Source: ESRI)

    Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

    Dmbld_ID

    Permit

    Editor
    Last editor of record. (Source: System)

    DateModify
    Last date of feature modification. (spatial and/or attribute) (Source: System)

    Shape
    Feature geometry. (Source: ESRI)

    Coordinates defining the features.

    GlobalID

    Shape.area

    Shape.len

Who produced the data set?

  1. Who are the originators of the data set? (may include formal authors, digital compilers, and editors)

    • City of Lynchburg, Virginia

  2. Who also contributed to the data set?

  3. To whom should users address questions about the data?

    of Lynchburg
    c/o Allison Johnson
    GIS Department
    900 Church St
    Lynchburg, VA 24504
    USA

    434.455.3940 (voice)
    434.847.1436 (FAX)
    Allison.Johnson@lynchburgva.gov

Why was the data set created?

The purpose of this data set is to show outline and location of demolished buildings.

How was the data set created?

  1. From what previous works were the data drawn?

    (source 1 of 1)
    of Lynchburg Department of GIS, Department of GIS.

  2. How were the data generated, processed, and modified?

    (process 1 of 3)
    Original GIS vector data was being maintained in GeoMedia. The GIS vector was then exported to AutoCAD (.dwg) format and/or ESRI shapefile (.shp) format then loaded into ESRI Geodatabase format.

    Date: 23-Mar-2009 (process 2 of 3)
    imported.

    Data sources used in this process:

    • T:\Shared\Worldview\Metadata\DemolishedBuilding.xml

    Date: 14-Jan-2010 (process 3 of 3)
    Dataset copied.

    Data sources used in this process:

    • \\tempest\Shared\GIS\Remediation Projects\ImperviousSurface\Final\Planimetric.mdb

  3. What similar or related data should the user be aware of?

How reliable are the data; what problems remain in the data set?

  1. How well have the observations been checked?

  2. How accurate are the geographic locations?

  3. How accurate are the heights or depths?

  4. Where are the gaps in the data? What is missing?

  5. How consistent are the relationships among the observations, including topology?

How can someone get a copy of the data set?

Are there legal restrictions on access or use of the data?

Access_Constraints:
Users of this data agree to the use constraints described in this metadata document.
Use_Constraints:
Pursuant to Section 54.1-402, paragraph C of the Code of Virginia, which is quoted below, this data may not be used for purposes listed in said paragraph C, since the data was not created, nor is it maintained under the supervision of a licensed land surveyor.

  1. Who distributes the data set? (Distributor 1 of 1)

    of Lynchburg
    c/o Allison Johnson
    GIS Department
    900 Church St
    Lynchburg, VA 24504
    USA

    434.455.3940 (voice)
    434.847.1436 (FAX)
    Allison.Johnson@lynchburgva.gov

  2. What's the catalog number I need to order this data set?

    Downloadable Data

  3. What legal disclaimers am I supposed to read?

    Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the use of the data on any other system, nor does the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

  4. How can I download or order the data?

    • Cost to order the data:
